history.content: There‘s no EECS berkeley connect. The closest one is computational biology CMPBIO 98/198 BC. The second closest one is Math 98/198BC.

children.subject: Agree, I also took Math 198BC with Patrick Lutz.

I took Berkeley Connect for math. My mentor was a graduate student in the math department who had also taught CS61B as a GSI and a bunch of other lower-division courses as a graduate instructor in the summer. He helped me a ton with course selection and future planning. 

My mentor did his undergrad at Berkeley though, so I think he was able to help me more. Usually, it's fair to assume that people with a math background would be familiar with CS course names (or topics) because they remain relatively unchanged, even your mentor comes from another school.

history.content:
I do not see any Berkeley Connect for EECS as a freshman on

https://classes.berkeley.edu/search/class/98BC?f%5B0%5D=im_field_term_name%3A1961&f%5B1%5D=im_field_subject_area%3A6&retain-filters=1.

I want to find a graduate mentor and group closest to EECS. Please advise the appropriate Connect group.

Thank you.
